sn7.14:1.2: Then a certain affluent brahmin, shabby, clad in a shabby cloak, approached the Blessed One  and exchanged greetings with him.
sn7.14:1.3: When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side, and the Blessed One then said to him:
sn7.14:1.4: “Why now, brahmin, are you so shabby, clad in a shabby cloak?”

sn7.14:1.7: “Well then, brahmin, learn these verses and recite them when the multitude has assembled in the meeting hall with your sons sitting together there:
sn7.14:2.1: “Those at whose birth I took delight
sn7.14:2.2: And whose success I much desired,
sn7.14:2.4: Chase me out as dogs chase swine.
sn7.14:3.2: Although they call me, ‘Dad, dear Dad.
sn7.14:3.3: They’re demons in the guise of sons
sn7.14:3.4: To abandon me when I’ve grown old.
sn7.14:4.1: “As an old horse of no more use
sn7.14:4.2: Is led away from its fodder,
sn7.14:4.3: So the old father of those boys
sn7.14:4.4: Begs for alms at others’ homes.
sn7.14:5.1: “Better for me is the staff I use
sn7.14:5.3: For the staff drives off the wild bull
sn7.14:5.4: And drives away the wild dog.
sn7.14:6.1: “In the dark it goes before me,
sn7.14:6.2: In the deep it gives me support.
sn7.14:6.3: By the gracious power of the staff,
sn7.14:6.4: If I stumble I still stand firm. ’

sn7.14:13.1: Then the sons led that affluent brahmin to their house, bathed him, and each gave him a pair of clothes.
sn7.14:13.2: Then that affluent brahmin, having taken one pair of clothes, approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.
sn7.14:13.3: Then he sat down to one side and said to the Blessed One:
sn7.14:13.4: “Master Gotama, we brahmins seek a teacher’s fee for our teacher.
sn7.14:13.5: Let Master Gotama accept a teacher’s fee from me.
sn7.14:13.6: The Blessed One accepted out of compassion.
sn7.14:13.7: Then that affluent brahmin said to the Blessed One:
sn7.14:13.9: Let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who from today has gone for refuge for life. “
